required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Qing'E Formula Therapy on Menopausal Symptoms (Healthy Volunteers Recruitment for Control Study)

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This study will recruit 50 healthy women with normal menstrual cycles aged 40-50, to investigate the expression of their NEI network and urine metabolomics.

primary_outcome.measure: The expression of NEI network and Urine metabolomics
primary_outcome.description: The indices of NEI network include: Hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis: CRH, ATCH, CORT Hypothalamic-pituitary-thyroid axis: TRH, T3, T4 Renin - angiotensin - aldosterone system: PRA, Ang2, ALD Sex hormones: E2, FSH Immune factors: TNF-α、IL-6、IL-1 Cardiovascular indicators: ET, NO, Hcy, Folic acid

arm_group.description: The objective of this study is to investigate the expression of NEI network and urine metabolomics of healthy women with normal menstrual cycles.

study_pop.textblock: Healthy women with normal menstrual cycles aged 40-50

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy women with normal menstrual cycles aged 40-50.
2. The score of Kupperman index is less than 15.
3. Not alcoholics or smokers (past or smoking).
4. Get subjects informed consent process should comply with GCP requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Volunteers with heart, liver, kidney disease or acute or chronic gastrointestinal diseases, or with diseases of blood, endocrine, neurological and other systems.
2. Volunteers are participating in other clinical trials within 3 months.
3. Volunteers who donated blood or loosed blood heavily within 3 months.
4. Volunteers with previous history of mental illness, drug abuse or drug dependence.
5. Volunteers who took drugs within 14 days before the trail.

facility.name: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine
